alert.note: Alert for Big Belt, Bridger and Castle Mountains; Gallatin Valley; Missouri Headwaters (Montana) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued June 08 at 2:28PM MDT by NWS GreatFalls
info.description: ...A strong thunderstorm will impact portions of northeastern Gallatin County through 300 PM MDT... At 227 PM MDT, Doppler radar was tracking a strong thunderstorm near Belgrade, or 10 miles northwest of Bozeman, moving northwest at 20 mph. HAZARD...Winds in excess of 30 mph and penny size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor damage to outdoor objects is possible. Locations impacted include... Belgrade, Manhattan and Menard. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.75 IN MAX WIND GUST...30 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. Conditions are favorable for the development of weak, brief funnel clouds. Theis type of funnel cloud is harmless, but on rare occasions they can briefly touch down, producing wind gusts over 50 mph. If a funnel cloud is spotted move indoors and report your sighting to the National Weather Service. Torrential rainfall is also occurring with this storm and may lead to localized flooding. Do not drive your vehicle through flooded roadways.
